reactions.desc: When an allied construct the Forgeborn Elite can see hits a hostile target with an attack, the Forgeborn Elite can make a weapon attack with advantage against that same target if the Forgeborn Elite is within 5 feet of it.

monsters.name: Krilium Makar, Blademaster
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Bladed Body
traits.desc: A creature that touches the Blademaster or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of him takes 13 (3d8) slashing damage.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the Blademaster fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Legendary Actions
traits.desc: The Blademaster can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Blademaster regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Blademaster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magitek Plating
traits.desc: Any critical hit against the Blademaster becomes a normal hit.

traits.name: Magitek-Spliced Resilience
traits.desc: The Blademaster has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, is immune to disease, and magic can't put him to sleep.

traits.name: Tyrannical Bolstering
traits.desc: Unless the Blademaster is incapacitated, constructs of his choice within 60 feet of him have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Blademaster makes two melee weapon attacks or three ranged weapon attacks.

actions.name: Swirling Master Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) lightning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone and stunned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Flying Swirling Blade
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 120 ft., up to three targets within 5 feet of each other. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) slashing damage. At the end of this attack, the Flying Blade returns to the Blademaster.

reactions.name: Tyrannical Rules Master (4/Day)
reactions.desc: The Blademaster can turn any attack roll, ability check, or saving throw into a success or vice versa, as long as the target creature making the roll is within line of sight of the Blademaster.

legendary_actions.name: Slashing Teleport
legendary_actions.desc: The Blademaster teleports to an unoccupied space he can see within line of sight that is next to another creature. He then makes a Swirling Master Blade attack and teleports again to another unoccupied space of his choice within 30 feet of the last place he teleported from.

legendary_actions.name: Blade Barrier (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Blademaster creates a vertical wall of whirling, razor-sharp blades made of magical energy. The wall appears within 120 feet of the Blademaster and lasts for 1 minute. The Blademaster can make a straight wall up to 100 feet long, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick, or a ringed wall up to 60 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 5 feet thick. The wall provides three-quarters cover to creatures behind it, and its space is difficult terrain. When a creature enters the wall's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must make a DC 17 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 33 (6d10) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage. The Blademaster cannot have more than two blade barriers active at a time.

monsters.name: Clockwork Dragon
monsters.languages: understands Common and Draconic but can't speak
monsters.damage_resistances: fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The Clockwork Dragon is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the Clockwork Dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Legendary Actions
traits.desc: The Clockwork Dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The skull dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.desc: Whenever the Clockwork Dragon is subjected to Lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Clockwork Dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magitek Plating
traits.desc: Any critical hit against the Clockwork Dragon becomes a normal hit.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Clockwork Dragon makes two melee weapon attacks of its choice or uses its breath weapon.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage plus 5 (1d10) lightning damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 19).

actions.name: Tail Smash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 5 (1d10) lightning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be pushed back 5 feet and knocked prone.

actions.name: Magitek-Powered Ray (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The Clockwork Dragon opens its maw and fires a ray of devastating forceful energy in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) force damage plus 16 (3d10) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Punishing Drop (Grappled Creatures Only)
bonus_actions.desc: The Clockwork Dragon flies up to half its speed with the grappled creature and then drops it from mid-air. The creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet of drop and lands prone.

reactions.name: Reflective Magitek Force Field
reactions.desc: Any time the Clockwork Dragon is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 3, the Clockwork Dragon is unaffected. On a 4 to 6, the Dragon is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the Clockwork Dragon, turning the caster into the target.

legendary_actions.name: Magitek-Guided Projectile
legendary_actions.desc: The Clockwork Dragon unleashes a guided projectile from its wings that crashes and burns against a point the Clockwork Dragon can see within 120 feet of it. Upon impact, all creatures in a 20-foot radius must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 5 (1d10) fire damage plus 5 (1d10) force damage on a failure, and half as much damage on a success. Additionally, any object that is not being worn or carried ignites.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Clockwork Dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 17 (2d10 + 6) force damage and be knocked prone. The Clockwork Dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Clockwork Flying Charge (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Clockwork Dragon flies 30 feet straight towards a space it can see and crashes against it. All creatures within 20 feet of the space must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 16 (3d10) force damage plus 16 (3d10) lightning damage and is pushed back 5 feet and knocked prone. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is only knocked prone.

monsters.name: Forgeborn Titan
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks
monsters.condition_immunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
monsters.languages: understands the languages of its creator

traits.name: Faithful Programming
traits.desc: The Forgeborn Titan cannot be made to act in any way contrary to its master's desire (unless it is down to 0 hit points and it is reprogrammed by a sufficiently skilled magitek engineer).

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.desc: The Forgeborn Titan is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the Forgeborn Titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Legendary Actions
traits.desc: The Forgeborn Titan can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The Forgeborn Titan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

traits.name: Titan of Destruction
traits.desc: When the Forgeborn Titan moves, it can move through any object or magical barrier as though it were difficult terrain, destroying it in the process. In addition, the Forgeborn Titan deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Forgeborn Titan makes two melee weapon attacks or one ranged weapon attack.

actions.name: Crushing Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) bludgeoning damage, and the target is restrained (escape DC 18). While restrained, the target takes 19 (3d12) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of its turns. The Titan can only restrain one creature this way.

actions.name: Chain Spike Cannon
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, range 120/240 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) bludgeoning damage plus 13 (3d8) piercing damage. Additionally, the chain spike emits a powerful electrical discharge, dealing 13 (3d8) lightning damage and the target cannot take reactions until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Targeting Beam
actions.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (3d12 + 6) force damage, and the target is marked by a beam of fluorescent red light until the end of the Titan's next turn. While the target is marked, attack rolls against them have advantage.

bonus_actions.name: Magitek Magnet
bonus_actions.desc: Each enemy within 30 feet of the Forgeborn Titan that is wearing metal or steel armor or is made of metal or steel must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the Titan.

legendary_actions.name: Sweeping Arm Buzzsaw
legendary_actions.desc: The Forgeborn Titan makes a sweep with its arm buzzsaw, and each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 17 (2d10 + 6) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Pulsing Visor
legendary_actions.desc: The Forgeborn Titan stares at a creature within 60 feet and hones in with mind-rending lights. A targeted creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or take 16 (3d10) psychic damage and become frightened of the Titan for 1 minute. A frightened creature can repeat its saving throw at the end of each of its turns (save ends).

legendary_actions.name: Crushing Leap (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Forgeborn Titan leaps 25 feet into the air in any direction and stomps at a point on the ground within leap distance. Any creature in a 10-foot-radius, 10-foot-high cylinder centered on this point must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take 16 (3d10) force damage and fall prone. Structures, as well as nonmagical objects that are neither being worn nor carried, take the same amount of damage if they are in the cylinder (no save).

monsters.name: Razubel, Clockmaster
monsters.damage_resistances: lightning, necrotic, psychic

traits.name: Magitek Machinery
traits.desc: This special equipment grants the Clockmaster all her resistances and immunities, as well as her spell attacks and Armor Class. This machinery can be targeted at a -3 penalty to attack rolls. It shares the same AC as the Clockmaster, has 100 hp, and immunity to psychic and poison damage. If destroyed, the Clockmaster's maximum hp is reduced to half its total and she has disadvantage on all attack rolls and saving throws.

traits.name: Blessing of the Void
traits.desc: The Clockmaster is immune to any spell or effect that would alter her form, move her against her will, or move her to another plane of existence against her will.

traits.name: Dark Devotion
traits.desc: The Clockmaster has advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If the Clockmaster fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Clockmaster has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The Clockmaster makes two melee spell attacks.

actions.name: Magitek Power Touch
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +10 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) force damage plus 13 (3d8) lightning damage and the target must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be stunned for 1 minute (save ends at end of turn).

actions.name: Legendary Engineer (3/Day)
actions.desc: The Clockmaster can magically repair a construct within 5 feet of her. The construct regains half its hit points total (rounded down).

actions.name: Clockwork Sorcery
actions.desc: The Clockmaster can cast the following spells, requiring no material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14):
spells: At will: command, dispel magic, heat metal, mending
3/day each: counterspell, dominate person, hold monster, mass suggestion, modify memory, plane shift (self only), telekinesis, telepathic bond
2/day each: commune (as an action), harm, legend lore, scrying
1/day each: finger of death, forbiddance, force cage, sunburst
1/week each: meteor swarm, time stop, true resurrection, weird

actions.name: Void Magitek Blast (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: The Clockmaster releases a blast of pulsating energy that burns with sheer force. Any creature within 30 feet of the blast must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) force damage plus 22 (4d10) psychic damage on a failure and being knocked prone, or half as much damage on a success and being shoved 5 feet toward an unoccupied space.

bonus_actions.name: Magitek Takeover (1/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The Clockmaster makes a DC 20 Intelligence (Arcana) check. On a success, she gains control over all constructs (not counting half-constructs) within 120 feet of her for the next minute. She must roll again at the beginning of each of her turns to continue this magitek takeover.

bonus_actions.name: Summon Construct (3/Day)
bonus_actions.desc: The Clockmaster summons 1d6+1 Steel Predators or 1d3+1 Forgeborn Elite. These constructs regard the Clockmaster as a regular Forgeborn Elite would regard the Blademaster. They appear in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of the Clockmaster and stop functioning if she is killed or falls unconscious.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
traits.desc: If Val Gultesh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Legendary Actions

actions.name: Claw

actions.name: Fear Wave (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Val Gultesh emits a wave of fear in a 30-foot radius. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and be frightened until the end of their next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Phantasmal Terror
legendary_actions.desc: Val Gultesh forces a creature within 30 feet to succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 8 (2d6) psychic damage and become paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Dark Flight (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Val Gultesh moves up to its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

traits.desc: If Val Gultesh fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Legendary Actions

actions.desc: Val Gultesh makes two claw attacks and uses its Mind Shatter.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8+6) slashing damage.

actions.name: Mind Shatter (Recharge 5-6)

legendary_actions.name: Phantasmal Terror
legendary_actions.desc: Val Gultesh forces a creature within 30 feet to succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (3d6) psychic damage and become paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

legendary_actions.name: Dark Flight (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: Val Gultesh moves up to its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monsters.name: Wereboar Apex
monsters.ac: 13 (humanoid), 15 (natural armor in beast or hybrid form)
monsters.languages: any one language (can’t speak in beast form)
monsters.damage_immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren’t wooden spears or silvered

traits.name: Shapechanger
traits.desc: The wereboar can use a bonus action to polymorph into a Large boar-humanoid hybrid or into a Large boar, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Brute
traits.desc: A melee attack deals one extra die of its damage when the wereboar hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Charge (Beast or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with its tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Vengeful Death
traits.desc: When the wereboar dies, it can move up to half its speed toward an enemy and make up to three melee attacks against creatures within 5 feet of it. It then immediately dies.

traits.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.desc: If the wereboar takes 28 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

traits.name: Swift
traits.desc: The wereboar can take the Dash action as a bonus action.

traits.name: Sure-Footed (Beast or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.desc: The wereboar has advantage on saving throws and ability checks against being knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The wereboar makes three attacks, only one of which can be with its tusks.

actions.name: Javelin (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) piercing damage.

actions.name: Maul (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tusks (Beast or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (3d6 + 5) slashing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with wereboar lycanthropy.

actions.name: Hooves (Beast or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Punish
reactions.desc: When the wereboar is hit by an attack from a creature within 5 feet of it, the wereboar can make one melee attack against that creature. On a hit, the target must succeed on a DC 17 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

legendary_actions.name: Attack
legendary_actions.desc: The wereboar makes one attack.

legendary_actions.name: Kick (Beast or Hybrid Form Only; Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The wereboar makes a melee weapon attack against a creature within 5 feet of it (+9 to hit). On a hit, the target takes 14 (2d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 10 feet.

legendary_actions.name: Tenacity
legendary_actions.desc: The next saving throw the wereboar makes before the end of its next turn is made with advantage.

monsters.name: High Cardinal Krozen
monsters.damage_resistances: radiant, necrotic

traits.name: Aura of Authority
traits.desc: Allies within 30 ft. have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (2/day)
traits.desc: If Krozen fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Krozen makes two Flame Staff attacks or casts one spell.

actions.name: Flame Staff
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6+4) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) radiant damage.

actions.name: Sacred Burst (Recharge 5-6)
actions.desc: Creatures within 20 ft. must make DC 16 Constitution saving throw or take 28 (8d6) radiant damage and be blinded until the end of their next turn. Half damage on success, no blindness.

spells: Krozen is a 10th-level spellcaster (Save DC 17, +9 to hit with spells).

spells.Level 1 (4 slots): Shield of Faith, Cure Wounds, Inflict Wounds

legendary_actions.name: Staff Attack
legendary_actions.desc: Krozen makes one Flame Staff attack.

legendary_actions.name: Terrifying Command (2 actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One enemy within 60 ft. must make DC 17 Wisdom save or become frightened and have disadvantage on attacks until end of Krozen's next turn.

monsters.name: Melisent
monsters.damage_resistances: necrotic

traits.name: Zealous Presence
traits.desc: Allies within 10 ft. of Melisent deal an extra 1d4 necrotic damage with melee weapon attacks.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Melisent makes two Silver Blade attacks or makes one Silver Blade attack and casts a spell.

actions.name: Silver Blade
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8+5) slashing damage plus 5 (1d10) necrotic damage.

spells: Melisent is a 6th-level caster (DC 15, +7 spell attacks).

monsters.name: The Primal
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, necrotic, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Prime Heart
traits.desc: The Primal and its Prime Heart are one and the same. As long as the place that serves as its Prime Heart remains intact, the Primal can reform its body within 1d5 days. If the Prime Heart is destroyed, the Primal is permanently destroyed.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Primal has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The Primal has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: One with the Land
traits.desc: The Primal is aware of the presence of any living creature that enters the Primal Grove but cannot pinpoint their location unless within 10 miles of the Prime Heart.

traits.name: Voice of the Wild
traits.desc: All beasts within the Primal Grove are under the effect of the *animal friendship* spell and will aid the Primal in and out of combat.

traits.name: Back to the Soil
traits.desc: If a creature dies within 30 feet of the Primal while in the Grove, the Primal regains 2d8 hit points by absorbing its remains as nutrients.

traits.name: Wild Shape
traits.desc: The Primal can use Wild Shape up to three times per day as an action or bonus action. While in beast form, it can cast spells ignoring verbal, somatic, and material components.

actions.name: Might of the Grove
actions.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

actions.name: Ray of Decay
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned for 1 minute.

actions.name: Wild Transformation
actions.desc: The Primal transforms into a beast native to its Grove (as per druid Wild Shape rules). It may also expend a use of Wild Shape to cast a spell without expending a spell slot.

legendary_actions.name: Cantrip
legendary_actions.desc: The Primal casts a cantrip.

legendary_actions.name: Grove Ray
legendary_actions.desc: The Primal makes a Might of the Grove or Ray of Decay attack.

legendary_actions.name: Root Stride
legendary_actions.desc: The Primal dissolves into roots and reappears in an unoccupied space within 30 ft. without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Wild Shape (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Primal uses Wild Shape and moves up to its new speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Ritual of Renewal (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: The Grove restores 2d8 + 5 hit points to the Primal.

spells: The Primal casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as its spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19, +11 to hit with spell attacks)

spells.Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, entangle, speak with animals, hold person, poison spray, thunderwave, moonbeam

spells.3/day each: counterspell, cure wounds (cast at 4th level), heat metal, lesser restoration, spike growth, wind wall

spells.2/day each: call lightning (as if outdoors), blight, sleet storm, tree stride, wall of thorns, polymorph

spells.1/day each: contagion, hallucinatory terrain, ice storm, antilife shell, earthquake, storm of vengeance

lair_actions.name: Lair Actions
lair_actions.desc: On initiative count 20 (losing ties), the Primal takes one or two lair actions. Cannot repeat the same effect twice in a row.

lair_actions.name: Uncontrolled Growth
lair_actions.desc: The ground becomes difficult terrain until the next round.

lair_actions.name: Hardened Bark
lair_actions.desc: The Primal’s AC increases by 3 until the next round.

lair_actions.name: Healing Suppression
lair_actions.desc: All magical healing except to the Primal is halved until the next round.

lair_actions.name: Misty Canopy
lair_actions.desc: All creatures except the Primal are blinded until the next round.

lair_actions.name: Spore Burst
lair_actions.desc: All enemies must make a DC 19 Constitution saving throw or suffer a random condition (1: Blinded, 2: Charmed, 3: Paralyzed, 4: Poisoned) until the next round.

lair_actions.name: Thorny Undergrowth
lair_actions.desc: Enemies take 1d8 piercing damage for every 5 ft. moved until the next round.

lair_actions.name: Purifying Pollen
lair_actions.desc: Ends ongoing magical effects in the Grove (e.g., walls, holds).

lair_actions.name: Healing Redirect
lair_actions.desc: All magical healing is halved for others and mirrored to the Primal.

lair_actions.name: Call of the Wild
lair_actions.desc: Summons 4 beasts of CR 1 or lower to fight for the Primal.

lair_actions.name: Awakened Defenders
lair_actions.desc: Summons 2 Awakened Trees at the edges of the lair.

lair_actions.name: Root Snare
lair_actions.desc: Enemies must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or be restrained.

lair_actions.name: Healing Lilies
lair_actions.desc: Two lilies (AC 5, HP 15) grow and heal the Primal for 3d4 per round each.

lair_actions.name: Buffing Mushrooms
lair_actions.desc: Four mushrooms (AC 15, HP 10) grow. Each adds +1 to the Primal’s damage rolls.

lair_actions.name: Grey Pollen Field
lair_actions.desc: Enemies are under an *antimagic field* until the next round.

monsters.name: Faenror, Verdant Fang
monsters.senses: darkvision 120 ft., truesight 30 ft., passive Perception 19
monsters.damage_resistances: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.desc: Faenror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Madness of the Lost Grove
traits.desc: At the start of Faenror’s turn, he must make a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, he has advantage on attack rolls against the nearest creature until the end of his turn.

traits.name: Guardian’s Vigil
traits.desc: While in forest terrain, Faenror regains 10 hit points at the start of his turn if he has at least 1 hit point and hasn’t taken fire damage since his last turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Faenror makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Verdant Fury (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: Roots and vines lash out from the earth in a 20-foot radius centered on Faenror. Each creature of his choice in the area must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or take 17 (5d6) piercing damage and become restrained until the end of their next turn. On a success, they take half damage and are not restrained.

actions.name: Blooming Howl (1/day)
actions.desc: Faenror unleashes a haunting howl imbued with fey magic. Each humanoid creature within 60 feet that can hear him must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of their next turn. While charmed this way, a creature is incapacitated and spends its turn smiling peacefully at the canopy.

bonus_actions.name: Hunter’s Instincts (Recharge 6)
bonus_actions.desc: Until the start of his next turn, Faenror gains truesight 60 ft. and can detect invisible or hidden creatures within 30 feet.

monsters.name: Gwynevel, Bloom-Touched Stag
monsters.damage_resistances: cold, lightning, necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.desc: Gwynevel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spirit of the Grove
traits.desc: While in natural terrain, Gwynevel is under the effects of the *sanctuary* spell (DC 16) and can’t be surprised.

traits.name: Aura of Verdant Grace
traits.desc: While Gwynevel is conscious, she emits a calming aura in a 30-foot radius. Friendly creatures in the aura regain 3 hit points at the start of their turn if they have at least 1 HP and have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Gwynevel makes two Verdant Antlers attacks.

actions.name: Verdant Antlers
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet and knocked prone.

actions.name: Bloom of Stillness (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: Each creature of Gwynevel’s choice in a 30-foot radius must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed until the end of their next turn. A creature charmed this way regards Gwynevel as a beloved protector and is unwilling to attack or move away from her.

actions.name: Seed of Submission
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +8 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target must succeed on a DC 16 Charisma saving throw or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn as visions of roots and vines pulling them into the earth overwhelm their mind.

reactions.name: Verdant Rebuke
reactions.desc: When Gwynevel is hit by an attack, spectral brambles lash out at the attacker. The attacker must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 10 (3d6) piercing damage and be restrained until the end of their next turn.

monsters.name: Nightcap
monsters.damage_resistances: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Ethereal Traveler
traits.desc: As a bonus action (see **Ethereal Shift**), the nightcap can step into the Ethereal Plane. While ethereal it is invisible and can see and attack creatures on the Material (or Fey) Plane, though it can’t be targeted from there. It returns to the plane it left at the start of its next turn or when it uses Ethereal Shift again.

traits.name: Night Cap
traits.desc: Magical dim light fills the area within 10 ft. of the nightcap, snuffing out nonmagical light in that radius.

traits.name: Full of Spores
traits.desc: A creature that touches the nightcap or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 ft. of it takes 10 (3d6) poison damage.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.desc: The nightcap’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The nightcap makes three Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Spore Bomb (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The nightcap shakes its cap, releasing a cloud of virulent spores in a 20-ft. radius centered on itself. Creatures in the area must make a DC 18 Constitution save, taking 36 (8d8) poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a success. A creature that fails is **poisoned** for 1 minute. A poisoned creature repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

actions.name: Leeching Shadow (Recharge 4–6)
actions.desc: The nightcap lashes out with its shifting silhouette at one creature it can see within 15 ft. The target must make a DC 18 Constitution save, taking 27 (6d8) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. On a failed save the target’s hit-point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the nightcap regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest.

bonus_actions.name: Ethereal Shift (Recharge 4–6)
bonus_actions.desc: The nightcap enters or leaves the Ethereal Plane as described in **Ethereal Traveler**.

reactions.name: Flicker Away
reactions.desc: When the nightcap is hit by an attack it can see, it halves the damage taken and teleports up to 15 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: Terror
monsters.damage_resistances: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Horrific Shifting
traits.desc: As a bonus action, the terror magically alters its form (see below), becoming Small, Medium, or Large and adopting any appearance it desires. It retains its statistics other than size. The change ends if the terror dies or uses this trait again.

traits.name: Fear Sense
traits.desc: The terror knows the specific phobias of any creature within 120 ft. of it. It has advantage on attack rolls against a creature that is frightened.

traits.name: Nightmare Reflection
traits.desc: A non-Fey creature that looks into the terror’s oily body for more than a moment must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or have disadvantage on its next saving throw. If it succeeds by 5 or more, it instead gains advantage on its next Wisdom saving throw.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The terror makes two attacks of the following types in any combination: Lash Out and Syphon Fear.

actions.name: Lash Out
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d10 + 3) slashing damage. If the target is **frightened**, it takes an extra 3 (1d6) psychic damage.

actions.name: Syphon Fear
actions.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) psychic damage, and the terror gains temporary hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

actions.name: Terrify (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The terror bombards one creature it can see within 60 ft. with nightmarish visions. The target must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw, taking 22 (5d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. On a failure, the target is **frightened** of the terror for up to 10 minutes. A frightened target repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success. The save is made with disadvantage if the terror is currently shaped as something the target fears.

reactions.name: Flicker of Dread
reactions.desc: When the terror is hit by an attack it can see, it halves the attack’s damage against it and teleports up to 15 ft. to an unoccupied space it can see.

monsters.name: Pleasantry
monsters.damage_resistances: psychic

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.desc: The pleasantry can’t be put to sleep by magical or non-magical means.

traits.name: Ethereal Traveler
traits.desc: While on the Material or Fey Plane, the pleasantry can see creatures on the Ethereal Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Save the Queen
traits.desc: When the Pleasantry Queen is targeted by an attack and the pleasantry is within 5 ft. of either the queen or the attacker, the pleasantry can use its reaction to become the new target.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the pleasantry regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt (rounded up).

actions.name: Sleep (1/Day)
actions.desc: The pleasantry casts *sleep* at 2nd level (spell save DC 13).

actions.name: Royal Sacrifice
actions.desc: The pleasantry sacrifices itself, immediately dying. The Pleasantry Queen can then roll one of her Hit Dice, regardless of whether she has any left, and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll.

monsters.name: Pleasantry Queen
monsters.damage_resistances: psychic

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.desc: The queen can’t be put to sleep by magical or non-magical means.

traits.name: Ethereal Traveler
traits.desc: While on the Material or Fey Plane, the queen can see creatures on the Ethereal Plane and vice-versa.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The queen makes two Stinger attacks or one Stinger attack and one Dreamflare Bolt.

actions.name: Stinger
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (4d8 + 6 plus 2d8) piercing and psychic damage, and the queen regains hit points equal to half the damage dealt.

actions.name: Dreamflare Bolt (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The queen hurls condensed nightmare energy at a creature she can see within 60 ft. The target must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

actions.name: Siphon Rest
actions.desc: The queen targets a sleeping creature within 30 ft. and rolls one of her Hit Dice, regaining that many hit points. A creature that has its rest siphoned three times before finishing a long rest dies.

bonus_actions.name: Ethereal Jump (Recharge 4–6)
bonus_actions.desc: The queen shifts into the Ethereal Plane until the start of her next turn, becoming invisible and untargetable from the plane she left.

reactions.name: Shimmer Step
reactions.desc: When the queen is hit by an attack she can see, she halves the attack’s damage and teleports up to 15 ft. to an unoccupied space she can see.

spells: The Pleasantry Queen casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as her spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks)

spells.3/day each: sleep, gust of wind, healing word

spells.2/day each: hypnotic pattern, dispel magic, greater invisibility

spells.1/day each: dominate person, moonbeam (4th-level), wall of thorns

lair_actions.name: Double Siphon
lair_actions.desc: The queen uses **Siphon Rest** on up to two different sleeping creatures.

lair_actions.name: Blinding Pollen
lair_actions.desc: Poppies release thick pollen. Until the next initiative count 20, creatures hostile to the queen are **blinded** while in the lair. A strong gust of wind ends the effect in an area.

lair_actions.name: Entangling Roots
lair_actions.desc: Flowering roots animate, turning the ground into difficult terrain for hostile creatures until the next initiative count 20.

monsters.name: Eve
monsters.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 17
monsters.damage_resistances: psychic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical attacks

traits.name: Constructed Physiology
traits.desc: Eva doesn’t need to eat, drink, or breathe. She has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and she is immune to disease.

traits.name: Lamanian Regeneration
traits.desc: While Eva is within natural vegetation, running water, or a manifest zone of Lamannia, she regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn. Fire damage prevents this regeneration until the start of her next turn.

traits.name: Guardian of Adam
traits.desc: While within 30 feet of the stasis cradle known as Adam, Eva gains a +2 bonus to AC and saving throws.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: Eva makes three Tendril Lash attacks.

actions.name: Tendril Lash
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage plus 9 (2d8) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be memory-hazed until the end of its next turn (it can’t make opportunity attacks and has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Intelligence checks).

actions.name: Grasp and Mend (Recharge 4–6)
actions.desc: One creature Eva can see within 30 feet must make a DC 16 Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is grappled (escape DC 16) and restrained by morphic tissue and living vines. While restrained this way, the target takes 13 (3d8) psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The effect ends if Eva is incapacitated or if the target escapes.

actions.name: Nemesis Pulse (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: Eva releases an audible psychic shock in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area that can hear her must make a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. On a failed save, the creature is dazed until the end of its next turn (it can’t take reactions and can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both). Creatures that can’t hear are unaffected.

reactions.name: Shifting Skin
reactions.desc: When Eva is hit by an attack, she reduces the damage by 10 (3d6) and can move up to 10 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Tendril
legendary_actions.desc: Eva makes one Tendril Lash attack.

legendary_actions.name: Slide
legendary_actions.desc: Eva moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary_actions.name: Nameless Echo (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One creature within 60 feet that has taken psychic damage since the start of Eva’s last turn must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by Eva until the end of its next turn. While charmed in this way, the creature can’t willingly move closer to Adam’s cradle and can’t target Eva with attacks or harmful abilities.

legendary_actions.name: Command the Created (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.desc: One allied construct or homunculus Eva can see within 60 feet can use its reaction to move up to half its speed or make one weapon attack.

traits.name: Arboreal Walker
traits.desc: The stalker ignores nonmagical difficult terrain made by trees and undergrowth and can move along vertical surfaces and upside down on branches and thick vines without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Camouflage in Foliage
traits.desc: The stalker has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide among trees and dense vegetation.

traits.name: Ambusher from Above
traits.desc: If the stalker drops at least 10 feet straight toward a creature and hits it with a melee attack on the same turn, the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The stalker makes two attacks, using Talons or Vine Whip in any combination.

actions.name: Talons
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Vine Whip
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 10 feet straight toward the stalker or lifted up to 10 feet into the branches (stalker’s choice). A creature lifted this way that then falls must succeed on a DC 10 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone when it lands.

actions.name: Skyline Pounce (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: The stalker leaps or drops up to 30 feet toward a creature and makes one Talons attack. On a hit, the attack deals an extra 10 (3d6) slashing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone. The stalker can then move up to half its climb speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monsters.name: Imago Littoral Enforcer (A-Delta)
monsters.damage_resistances: poison

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.desc: The enforcer can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Augmented Physiology
traits.desc: The enforcer has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and against disease.

traits.name: Water Wrangler
traits.desc: The enforcer has advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks to grapple or shove a creature while either creature is in or adjacent to water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The enforcer makes two attacks, using Barbed Gaff or Webbed Claws in any combination.

actions.name: Barbed Gaff
actions.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is in or adjacent to water, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 15 feet straight toward the enforcer. If this pull moves the target from water onto solid ground, the target falls prone.

actions.name: Webbed Claws
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tidal Grasp (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: A tendril of water lashes a creature the enforcer can see within 30 feet that is in or adjacent to water. The target must make a DC 14 Strength saving throw, taking 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a success. On a failed save, the target is also pulled up to 30 feet straight toward the enforcer. If this movement ends on land, the target is knocked prone and is restrained by slick kelp until the end of its next turn (escape DC 14).

reactions.name: Undertow Riposte
reactions.desc: When a hostile creature within 5 feet of the enforcer leaves water, the enforcer makes one Barbed Gaff attack against it.

monsters.name: Imago Burrowing Mauler (B-Theta)
monsters.damage_resistances: bludgeoning from nonmagical attacks while underground

traits.name: Earth Swimmer
traits.desc: The mauler can burrow through sand, loose earth, and soft clay, but not through solid stone. While burrowed, it has total cover.

traits.name: Churning Ground
traits.desc: Spaces the mauler burrows through become difficult terrain until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Augmented Physiology
traits.desc: The mauler has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and against disease.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.desc: The mauler makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage.

actions.name: Drag Under (Recharge 5–6)
actions.desc: A creature on the ground within 5 feet of the mauler must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or take 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, be knocked prone, and become grappled (escape DC 14). While grappled this way, the creature is restrained and partially buried; if it can’t breathe underground, it must hold its breath. The grapple ends if the mauler is incapacitated, isn’t touching the ground, or moves more than 5 feet away.

reactions.name: Earthen Rebuff
reactions.desc: When a creature the mauler can sense with its tremorsense misses it with a melee attack while both are on the ground, the mauler burrows up to half its burrow speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

monsters: Blight (within 1 mile of the Death Bloom)

monsters.name: Blight (within 1 mile of the Death Bloom)
monsters.damage_resistances: Cold; Necrotic; Poison; Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing from Nonmagical Attacks
monsters.languages: The languages it knew in life, plus Druidic

traits.name: Death Bloom Phylactery
traits.desc: The Blight is bound to a vast, corrupted memorial grove known as the Death Bloom. The grove is its phylactery. When the Blight’s body is destroyed, its soul retreats into the Death Bloom and reforms a new body there in 1d4 + 1 days, along with all missing body parts and gear it carried when it died. If the Death Bloom is destroyed, the Blight is destroyed as well and can't reform.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.desc: The Blight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.desc: The Blight has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns Undead.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.desc: If the Blight fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead. It can use this trait up to 3 times per day.

traits.name: One with the Land
traits.desc: The entire Memorial is the Blight’s lair. The Blight is aware whenever a living creature enters the Memorial, though it doesn't know the creature's exact location or identity until that creature comes within 300 feet of the Death Bloom or otherwise reveals itself (for example, by casting a spell or shedding bright light).

traits.name: Voice of the Land
traits.desc: While the Blight lives, all Beasts that dwell in the Memorial are under the effect of <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/spells/animal-friendship-xphb.md|Animal Friendship<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK> toward it. Such Beasts won't willingly attack the Blight and will defend it to the best of their ability if it is threatened.

traits.name: Back to the Soil
traits.desc: When a creature dies within 30 feet of the Blight while in the Memorial, the Blight absorbs the creature’s body into the soil and regains 2d8 hit points.

traits.name: Death Grove
traits.desc: The Blight’s weapon attacks and spell attacks deal an extra 3 (1d6) necrotic damage on a hit.

traits.name: Reactive Roots
traits.desc: When a creature within 5 feet of the Blight moves out of that range, the Blight can make one Might of the Memorial attack against that creature as a reaction.

traits.name: Wild Shape
traits.desc: The Blight magically assumes the form of a Beast that lives within the Memorial with a challenge rating 5 or lower, or it returns to its true form. Its game statistics, other than HP, are replaced by those of the chosen Beast, but it retains its alignment, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma, as well as its saving throw and skill bonuses. It gains temp HP equal to HP of the creature it turned into. It can cast its spells while in this form and doesn't need verbal, somatic, or material components. The transformation lasts until the Blight temp HP drops to 0 hit points or uses a bonus action to end it.

traits.name: Spellcasting
traits.desc:

regional_effects.name: The Memorial Lair
regional_effects.desc:
The region containing the Death Bloom Memorial is warped by the Blight’s presence. The entire Memorial counts as the Blight’s lair.

2. **Hardened Bark.** The soil’s nutrients surge into the Blight’s bark-like skin. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, the Blight’s AC increases by 2.
3. **Mist of the Memorial.** Dew condenses into a thick, silvery mist. The Blight chooses a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. The area is Heavily Obscured until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature of the Blight’s choice in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the Blinded condition until initiative count 20 on the next round.
4. **Prismatic Spores.** Mushrooms sprout and shake their caps in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the Blight can see within 120 feet, releasing multicolored spores. Each creature hostile to the Blight in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with one random condition until initiative count 20 on the next round. Roll a d4: 1: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Blinded|Blinded<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>; 2: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Poisoned|Poisoned<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>; 3: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Restrained|Restrained<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>; 4: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Charmed|Charmed<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>
5. **Thorny Vines.** Thorn-covered vines snake across the ground of the lair. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, whenever a creature hostile to the Blight moves more than 5 feet on the ground in the lair, that creature takes 4 (1d8) Piercing damage for every 5 feet it moves.
6. **Redirected Bloom.** The flowers of the lair absorb healing magic and redirect it toward the Blight. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, whenever a creature other than the Blight within 60 feet of it regains Hit Points from a spell or other magical effect, that creature regains only half as many Hit Points (round up), and the Blight regains the same number of Hit Points.
7. **Beast Call.** The animals dwelling in the lair come to the Blight’s defense. The Blight summons up to four Beasts of challenge rating 1 or lower, which appear in unoccupied spaces at the edges of the lair. The summoned Beasts roll initiative as a group and act on their own turns. They remain until destroyed or until the Blight uses this lair action again.
8. **Awakened Trees.** The plants of the lair twist and combine to form two Awakened Trees in unoccupied spaces the Blight can see. Each awakened tree rolls its own initiative and acts on its own turn. The trees remain until destroyed or until the Blight uses this lair action again.
9. **Entangling Roots.** Roots rise from the soil of the lair, entangling the Blight’s enemies. Each creature hostile to the Blight that is on the ground in the lair must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or have the Restrained condition. A restrained creature can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against the same DC, ending the effect on itself on a success.
10. **Healing Lilies.** Two enormous lilies (Medium Plants) grow in two unoccupied spaces the Blight can see within 60 feet. Each lily has AC 5 and 15 Hit Points. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, at the start of each of the Blight’s turns, it regains 7 (2d6) Hit Points for each lily that remains. The lilies wither at initiative count 20 on the next round.
11. **Damage Mushrooms.** Four enormous mushrooms (Medium Plants) grow in unoccupied spaces the Blight can see within 60 feet. Each mushroom has AC 15 and 10 Hit Points. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, the Blight’s weapon attacks and spell attacks deal an extra 1 damage for each mushroom that remains (maximum +4). The mushrooms wither at initiative count 20 on the next round.
12. **Antimagic Pollen.** The flowers of the lair shake, releasing a gray pollen that dulls all color and stifles foreign magic. The Blight chooses a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, that area functions as an antimagic zone for creatures hostile to the Blight: such creatures can't cast spells while in the area, and their ongoing spells and magical effects are suppressed there, as are the magical properties of items they wield or carry. The Blight’s own magic and that of its allies are unaffected.

If the Blight is destroyed and its Death Bloom phylactery is also destroyed, these effects end immediately. If only its body is destroyed, the lair effects persist as long as the Death Bloom remains intact.

regional_effects.name: The Memorial Lair
regional_effects.desc:
The region containing the Death Bloom Memorial is warped by the Blight’s presence. The entire Memorial counts as the Blight’s lair.

**Lair Actions.** While in its lair, on initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Blight can use one of the following lair action options. The Blight can't use the same effect two rounds in a row. The saving throw DC for these effects is 18.

1. **Unmitigated Growth.** The Blight instigates unmitigated plant growth on its lair, turning the floor into difficult terrain until initiative count 20 on the next round.
2. **Hardened Bark.** The soil’s nutrients surge into the Blight’s bark-like skin. Until initiative count 20 on the next round, the Blight’s AC increases by 2.
3. **Mist of the Memorial.** Dew condenses into a thick, silvery mist. The Blight chooses a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point it can see within 120 feet. The area is Heavily Obscured until initiative count 20 on the next round. Each creature of the Blight’s choice in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or have the Blinded condition until initiative count 20 on the next round.
4. **Prismatic Spores.** Mushrooms sprout and shake their caps in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point the Blight can see within 120 feet, releasing multicolored spores. Each creature hostile to the Blight in that area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be afflicted with one random condition until initiative count 20 on the next round. Roll a d4: 1: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Blinded|Blinded<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>; 2: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Poisoned|Poisoned<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>; 3: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Restrained|Restrained<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>; 4: <STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>Інструменти%20ДМ/CLI/rules/conditions.md#Charmed|Charmed<STATBLOCK-MARKDOWN-LINK>

If the Blight is destroyed and its Death Bloom phylactery is also destroyed, these effects end immediately. If only its body is destroyed, the lair effects persist as long as the Death Bloom remains intact.
